spanishExample: No he usado el nuevo puente en el parque.
englishTranslation: I haven’t used the new bridge in the park.
vocabIncluded: he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Nunca ganamos, es imposible.
englishTranslation: We never win, it’s impossible.
vocabIncluded: ganamos: win/earn, we win/earn (Ganar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Puedes usarlo en la plaza, pero no en ningún otro sitio.
englishTranslation: You can use it at the square, but not at any other site.

spanishExample: Quiero que pague el café, porque yo siempre pago.
englishTranslation: I want him to pay for the coffee, because I always pay.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pago: pay, I pay (Pagar, present, 1st person)
pague: pay, he/she/it pay (Pagar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No creo que funcione, pero igual díselo.
englishTranslation: I don’t think it will work, but still tell it to him.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
díselo: tell it to him/her (Decir, imperative contraction) NEEDS WORK
funcione: function/work, he/she/it function/work (Funcionar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
igual: in the same way / equally (adverb)

spanishExample: No gano mucho dinero porque no me pagan mucho.
englishTranslation: I don’t earn much money because they don’t pay me much.
vocabIncluded: gano: win/earn, I win/earn (Ganar, present, 1st person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
pagan: pay, they pay (Pagar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: ¿Ganaste dinero? ¡Dáselo!
englishTranslation: Did you win money? Give it to him!
vocabIncluded: dáselo: give it to him/her (Dar, imperative contraction)
ganaste: won/earned, you won/earned (Ganar, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡Pague en la entrada!
englishTranslation: (Formal) Pay at the entrance!

spanishExample: No la he conseguido, ¡dámela!
englishTranslation: I haven’t gotten it(f), give it to me!
vocabIncluded: dámela: give it/her to me (Dar, imperative contraction)
he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Si sigues la acera, llegarás a la dirección correcta.
englishTranslation: If you follow the sidewalk, you’ll get to the right address.
vocabIncluded: sigues: continue/follow, you continue/follow (Seguir, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Siempre lo consigo, pero nunca lo usamos.
englishTranslation: I always get it, but we never use it.
vocabIncluded: consigo: acquire/get, I acquire/get (Conseguir, present, 1st person)
usamos: use, we use (Usar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Quiero que él gane porque es excelente.
englishTranslation: I want him to win because he is excellent.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
gane: win/earn, he/she/it win/earn (Ganar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si usas eso en la carretera, será raro, así que dámelo.
englishTranslation: If you use that on the road, it will be weird, so give it to me.
vocabIncluded: dámelo: give it/him to me (Dar, imperative contraction)
será: "will be", "he/she/it will be" (Ser, future, 3rd person)
usas: use, you use (Usar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Tú nunca ganas y ella siempre consigue lo que quiere.
englishTranslation: You never win and she always gets what she wants.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
consigue: acquires/gets, he/she/it acquires/gets (Conseguir, present, 3rd person)
ganas: win/earn, you win/earn (Ganar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Siempre usa el puente para llegar al otro estado.
englishTranslation: She always uses the bridge to get to the other state.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive
usa: uses, he/she/it uses (Usar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No puede conseguir nada en esa zona de la ciudad.
englishTranslation: He can’t get anything in that area of the city.

spanishExample: ¡Consiga una nueva zona para nuestro juego!
englishTranslation: (Formal) Get a new area for our game!

spanishExample: No ganó y tienes que decírselo.
englishTranslation: He didn’t win and you have to tell it to him.
vocabIncluded: decírselo: to tell it to him/her/them (Decir infinitive+contraction)
ganó: won/earned, he/she/it won/earned (Ganar, preterite, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: No ganamos, el juego fue terrible.
englishTranslation: We didn’t win, the game was terrible.
vocabIncluded: ganamos: won/earned, we won/earned (Ganar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: La entrada de este sitio está en el otro lado de la plaza.
englishTranslation: The entrance of this site is on the other side of the plaza.

spanishExample: Usó la acera porque era segura.
englishTranslation: He used the sidewalk because it was safe.
vocabIncluded: seguro: adjective meaning "safe" or "secure" when used with Ser
usó: used, he/she/it used (Usar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Nunca paga y por eso esas cosas no funcionan.
englishTranslation: He never pays and that’s why those things don’t work.
vocabIncluded: funcionan: function/work, they function/work (Funcionar, present, 3rd person plural)
paga: pays, he/she/it pays (Pagar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Usaba el teléfono que conseguimos.
englishTranslation: I was using the phone we got.
vocabIncluded: conseguimos: acquired/got, we acquired/got (Conseguir, preterite, 1st person plural)
usaba: used, I used (Usar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¿Conseguiste el mismo que él usa?
englishTranslation: Did you get the same one that he uses?
vocabIncluded: conseguiste: acquired/got, you acquired/got (Conseguir, preterite, 2nd person)
usa: uses, he/she/it uses (Usar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No has pagado, pero si pagas, lo consigues.
englishTranslation: You haven’t paid, but if you pay, you get it.
vocabIncluded: consigues: acquire/get, you acquire/get (Conseguir, present, 2nd person)
has: "have", "you have" before a participle (Haber, present, 2nd person)
pagas: pay, you pay (Pagar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Consíguelo antes de que yo gane.
englishTranslation: Get it before I win.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
gane: win/earn, I win/earn (Ganar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: No lo consiguió, aunque lo pagó.
englishTranslation: He didn’t get it, even though he paid for it.
vocabIncluded: consiguió: acquired/got, he/she/it acquired/got (Conseguir, preterite, 3rd person)
pagó: paid, he/she/it paid (Pagar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Ha estado ganando por años, no creo que tenga que pagar.
englishTranslation: He has been winning for years, I don’t think he has to pay.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Aunque pague, esto no funciona.
englishTranslation: Even if I pay, this still doesn’t work.
vocabIncluded: funciona: functions/works, he/she/it functions/works (Funcionar, present, 3rd person)
pague: pay, I pay (Pagar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: No quiero que lo use, porque estará en un infierno.
englishTranslation: I don’t want her to use it, because she’ll be in hell.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
estará: "will be", "he/she/it will be" (Estar, future, 3rd person)
use: use, he/she/it use (Usar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Esto es estúpido, ella siempre gana.
englishTranslation: This is stupid, she always wins.
vocabIncluded: gana: wins/earns, he/she/it wins/earns (Ganar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No gané, pero conseguí dinero.
englishTranslation: I didn’t win, but I got money.
vocabIncluded: conseguí: acquired/got, I acquired/got (Conseguir, preterite, 1st person)
gané: won/earned, I won/earned (Ganar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¡Bienvenido al tercer piso! Es el más divertido.
englishTranslation: Welcome to the third floor! It’s the most fun.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: ¡Paga por algo nuevo! Tienes que conseguirlo en este espacio.
englishTranslation: Pay for something new! You have to get it in this space.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: La salida no es la ventana, estamos en el segundo piso.
englishTranslation: The exit isn’t the window, we are on the second floor.

spanishExample: Si quieres ganar más espacio, dímelo.
englishTranslation: If you want to win more space, tell it to me.
vocabIncluded: dímelo: tell it to me (Decir, imperative contraction) NEEDS WORK

spanishExample: Esto no está funcionando, el suelo no es seguro.
englishTranslation: This isn’t working, the floor isn’t safe.
vocabIncluded: seguro: adjective meaning "safe" or "secure" when used with Ser

spanishExample: Cuando ganan, siempre es interesante.
englishTranslation: When they win, it’s always interesting.
vocabIncluded: ganan: win/earn, they win/earn (Ganar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Quiero que consiga lo que ha ganado.
englishTranslation: I want him to get what he has earned.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
consiga: acquire/get, he/she/it acquire/get (Conseguir, subjunctive, 3rd person)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No lo usamos, así que no lo pagaré.
englishTranslation: We didn’t use it, so I won’t pay for it.
vocabIncluded: pagaré: will pay, I will pay (Pagar, future, 1st person)
usamos: used, we used (Usar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Quiere que use la próxima salida.
englishTranslation: He wants me to use the next exit.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
use: use, I use (Usar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¿Sabes la dirección para nuestro destino?
englishTranslation: Do you know the address for our destination?

spanishExample: Vivo en un nuevo estado donde usan esto todo el tiempo.
englishTranslation: I live in a new state where they use this all the time.
vocabIncluded: usan: use, they use (Usar, present, 3rd person plural)
vivo: live, I live (Vivir, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Lo conseguiré cuando llegue a mi destino.
englishTranslation: I’ll get it when I get to my destination.
vocabIncluded: conseguiré: will acquire/get, I will acquire/get (Conseguir, future, 1st person)
llegue: arrive, I arrive (Llegar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Pagará por las cosas que ha estado usando.
englishTranslation: He’ll pay for the things he’s been using.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
pagará: will pay, he/she/it will pay (Pagar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Usaba mis cosas sin decírmelo.
englishTranslation: He was using my things without telling me it.
vocabIncluded: decírmelo: to tell it to me (Decir infinitive+ contraction)
usaba: used, he/she/it used (Usar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si conseguimos suficientes personas, el parque funcionará.
englishTranslation: If we get enough people, the park will work.
vocabIncluded: conseguimos: acquire/get, we acquire/get (Conseguir, present, 1st person plural)
funcionará: will function/work, he/she/it will function/work (Funcionar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Yo siempre uso la ventana de la sala, pero tú no puedes usarla.
englishTranslation: I always use the living room window, but you can’t use it.
vocabIncluded: uso: use, I use (Usar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No funcionó, esto aún es un infierno.
englishTranslation: It didn’t work, this is still hell.
vocabIncluded: funcionó: functioned/worked, he/she/it functioned/worked  (Funcionar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Use la carretera, o si no puede, dígamelo.
englishTranslation: (Formal) Use the road, or if you can’t, tell it to me.
vocabIncluded: dígamelo: tell it to me (Decir, formal imperative contraction)

spanishExample: Tienen que decírnoslo antes de decírtelo.
englishTranslation: They have to tell it to us before telling it to you.
vocabIncluded: decírnoslo: to tell it to us (Decir infinitive+ contraction)
decírtelo: to tell it to you (Decir infinitive+contraction)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Tengo que dárselo para que lo pueda usar.
englishTranslation: I have to give it to him so he can use it.
vocabIncluded: dárselo: to give it to him/her (Dar infinitive) + contraction
pueda: "be able", "he/she/it be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Ella quiere que yo consiga un nuevo trabajo.
englishTranslation: She wants me to get a new job.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
consiga: acquire/get, I acquire/get (Conseguir, subjunctive, 1st person)
